channel.title: Bank command not working
channel.description: okay my bank command doesnt full work or something because i do ::bank and the bank appears and i can remove items from it but i can't put items into the bank unless i actually go to a bank. any clue why it does that?

item.title: Bank command not working
item.dc:creator: @gs_pk_pure gs pk pure
item.description:
@gs_pk_pure wrote:

God11:

well im not sure how to change the bank method still a newbie coder sorry. but well i guess im cool with just going to a bank and bankin. so thanks for the help

Lol a senior member and a Nooby coder…Seriously, And most server’s are better without bank command’s but heres one that you might want to try

} // else if (command.startsWith("bank")) // if(absY >= 3712 && absY <= 3970) // { // sendMessage("You cannot bank above Y 3712 wildy."); // } // else // { // openUpBank(); // }

Thats my command that i found on my server

Read full topic

item.title: Bank command not working
item.dc:creator: @Patrick1 Patrick_
item.description:
@Patrick1 wrote:

[quote=“NewbieNewty, post:7, topic:261377”]You don’t need to do it Patricks way.

Just do it like most server’s do. Check for your bank command, (Under your Custom Command Void. Then make sure it looks similar to this

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("bank") && playerRights > 1) { openUpBank();

Or similar to that. Replace openUpBank(); with whatever your bank method is.[/quote]

Kid, honestly. Just use different methods because there are better ways to construct things imo. But, then again it’s your preference.

Read full topic

item.title: Bank command not working
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

You don’t need to do it Patricks way.

Just do it like most server’s do. Check for your bank command, (Under your Custom Command Void. Then make sure it looks similar to this

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("bank") && playerRights > 1) { openUpBank();

Or similar to that. Replace openUpBank(); with whatever your bank method is.

Read full topic

item.title: Bank command not working
item.dc:creator: @Patrick1 Patrick_
item.description:
@Patrick1 wrote:

Well, how are you executing your Commands? Are you using a switch statement, a multidimensional array? There are different ways to execute commands like LinkedLists;

[code]public class Commands implements Packet
{

static List<String> list = new LinkedList<String>();
    static{
        getList().add("bank");
    }

public void processPacket(Client c, int packetType, int packetSize) {
    if(getList().contains("bank")){
        new BankCommand();
    }
}

public static List<String> getList(){
    return list;
}

}[/code]

Then you must create the file…

[code]public class BankCommand {

public BankCommand() {

}

}[/code]

You must execute it then, which is basically sending an interface.

Edit: I might of forgotten some imports for the Linked List to actually work; I believe it’s in java.util.LinkedList, but not sure. You’d have to figure it out on your own because I’m to lazy to check.

Read full topic
